headline: Datadog raises annual forecast betting on AI-driven cybersecurity demand
summary: Datadog raised its full-year revenue to be about $2.66 billion, compared to its earlier expectation of between $2.62 billion and $2.63 billion.  An increasing number of Datadog customers are deploying their artificial intelligence apps in live production, which is expected to boost usage of the company's products.  AI apps run in the cloud, and a large-scale migration to the cloud is anticipated, boding well for companies such as Datadog, which provide monitoring software for cloud infrastructure.

headline: Datadog (DDOG) Beats Q3 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
summary: Datadog (DDOG) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of 17.95% and 4.15%, respectively, for the quarter ended September 2024. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Datadog Earnings Beat Expectations. Why the Stock Is Falling Anyway.
summary: Datadog reported better-than-expected profit and revenue in the third quarter, but the software company’s stock fell as its guidance didn’t appeal to investors.  New-York based Datadog, which helps clients detect and analyze malicious activity in real time, posted adjusted earnings of 46 cents a share for the three months through September, Thursday morning.  Quarterly revenue grew by 26% from a year earlier to $690 million, while the consensus call was for $665 million.

headline: Datadog Q3 earnings beat estimates, stock falls
summary: Investing.com -- Datadog, Inc. (NASDAQ: DDOG) reported third-quarter earnings that surpassed analyst expectations, but its stock fell 2.6% premarket on Thursday following the release.

headline: Datadog: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of 13 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 39 cents per share. The data analytics and cloud monitoring company posted revenue of $690 million in the period, also exceeding Street forecasts. Thirteen analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $662.6 million.

headline: Datadog (NASDAQ:DDOG) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q3, But Billings Missed
summary: Cloud monitoring software company Datadog (NASDAQ:DDOG) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q3 CY2024, with sales up 26% year on year to $690 million. The company expects next quarter’s revenue to be around $711 million, close to analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.46 per share was also 15.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
